thread.title: Trump eats $50 steak with ketchup, foodies aghast
thread.title_full: Trump eats $50 steak with ketchup, foodies aghast - seattlepi.com

title: Trump eats $50 steak with ketchup, foodies aghast
text:
President Donald Trump dined out in secret Saturday at the BLT Prime steakhouse in his new flagship property, the Trump Hotel in D.C., and ordered his usual — a very well-done New York strip steak with a side of ketchup, according to the Independent Journal Review.
Foodies were appalled. It's one thing to turn an aged, grass-fed, $54 cut of beefsteak into a rawhide chew, but the ketchup?! Twitter gourmets dished out their disdain.
Trump eating a well done steak w/ ketchup. Dawg...
WHAT MORE DO YOU NEED FOR AN IMPEACHMENT !?!
— André Leon Stalley (@PhreshTooDeaf) February 26, 2017 "Psst...Trump orders steaks well done with ketchup. Pass it down" pic.twitter.com/jAQotAAAav
— Sabith Maliackal (@SABmetrics) February 27, 2017 Don't let the Oscars Best Picture screwup be a distraction from the fact that Trump eats his well-done steaks with KETCHUP
— Helen Rosner (@hels) February 27, 2017 But Trump's tastes are actually not out that of the ordinary when it comes to presidential palates. Look at the favorite comfort foods of his predecessors:
Barack Obama: Loves Fran's Smoked Salted Caramels
George W. Bush: Cheeseburger pizza
Bill Clinton: Jalapeño cheeseburgers
George H.W. Bush: Pork rinds with Tabasco
Ronald Reagan: Jelly beans
Richard Nixon: Cottage cheese with ketchup (shudder)
Harry Truman: Steak, well-done
Trump has never been a particularly healthy eater. During the campaign, he often filled up on junk food — Domino's, KFC and McDonald's. He reportedly enjoyed Big Macs served on silver trays on his private jet.
Since being elected as the oldest president in U.S. history, the 70-year-old Trump has reverted to his regular meat-and-potatoes regimen, varying it occasionally with fish. It's doubtful the president follows government guidelines that dictate anywhere from 7 to 13 cups of produce daily.
His favorite snacks are Keebler Vienna Fingers and Lay's Potato Chips washed down with a Diet Coke, according to aide Quote: d by the news site Axios.
What may be more disturbing than his diet is his lack of exercise. George W. Bush stayed in great condition by mountain-biking regularly, Reagan chopped wood and Obama was a workout junkie while in the White House. The most exercise Trump gets is on the golf course roughly once a week or less, and most of the time he rides in a cart.
In September, at a taping of "The Dr. Oz Show," Trump apparently revealed that he weighs 236 pounds and stands 6-foot-3, according to the New York Daily News. But later it was reported that he's actually 267 pounds.
The would put his body mass index at either 29.5, at the upper end of the "overweight" scale, or 33.4, "obese" territory.
Trump made his health an issue in 2015 when his doctor, Harold Bornstein, declared that Trump would "be the healthiest individual ever elected to the presidency."
